summary: The bill, the Taskforce for Recognizing and Averting Payment Scams Act (TRAPS Act), mandates the Secretary of the Treasury to establish a task force to combat payment scams. This task force will include representatives from various federal agencies, financial institutions, and consumer groups. The task force's duties involve analyzing current scam trends, assessing international prevention strategies, developing consumer education programs, coordinating law enforcement efforts, and making legislative recommendations. The task force will issue a report within a year of establishment and annual updates thereafter, focusing on improving scam detection, prevention, and prosecution. The task force will sunset three years after submitting the initial report.
